com.github.davidmoten.reels

Interface SupervisedActorRef<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ActorRef<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActorRefImpl, ActorRefSynchronizedDrain, ActorRefUnsynchronizedDrain, RootActorRefImpl

    public interface SupervisedActorRef<T>
extends ActorRef<T>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean pause(long duration, TimeUnit unit)
      Pauses message processing for the given duration.
      boolean pauseAndRestart(long delay, TimeUnit unit)
      Will restart the actor after the given given delay on the next message polled from the queue (mailbox).
      boolean restart()
      Recreates the Actor object that processes messages on the next message polled from the queue (mailbox).
      void retry()
      Ensures that the message that prompted failure is retried (for example with a delay and a restarted actor if you also call pauseAndRestart(long, TimeUnit)).

      • Methods inherited from interface com.github.davidmoten.reels.ActorRef

        ask, child, children, context, isStopped, name, narrow, none, parent, recast, scheduler, stop, stopNow, tell, tell

    • Method Detail

      • restart

        boolean restart()
        Recreates the Actor object that processes messages on the next message polled from the queue (mailbox). Should be called synchronously from the Supervisor object.
        Returns:
        true if and only if command accepted (for example if actor disposed or stopped then won't be accepted)

      • pauseAndRestart

        boolean pauseAndRestart(long delay,
                        TimeUnit unit)
        Will restart the actor after the given given delay on the next message polled from the queue (mailbox). Until that time the actor is in a paused state and no messages will be processed (messages will be buffered in-memory). Once restarted message processing resumes.

        Note especially that it is a good idea to keep the delay short because a graceful shutdown of actors (via Context.shutdownGracefully() will have to wait for the actor to be unpaused (to process the stop message).

        Parameters:
        delay - time till restart called
        unit - duration unit
        Returns:
        true if and only if command accepted (for example if actor disposed or stopped then won't be accepted)

      • pause

        boolean pause(long duration,
              TimeUnit unit)
        Pauses message processing for the given duration.

        Note especially that it is a good idea to keep the delay short because a graceful shutdown of actors (via Context.shutdownGracefully() will have to wait for the actor to be unpaused (to process the stop message).

        Parameters:
        duration - duration of pause
        unit - duration unit
        Returns:
        true if and only if command accepted (for example if actor disposed or stopped then won't be accepted)

      • retry

        void retry()
        Ensures that the message that prompted failure is retried (for example with a delay and a restarted actor if you also call pauseAndRestart(long, TimeUnit)).
